column3: Concept ACK, but the reason string isn't wiped on success or between checks. It slightly increases review burden, but having `IsStandardTx` wipe the reason string immediately on entrance is a small reasoning improvement to make sure the string isn't accidentally being kept between calls.\n\nAFAIK the only "real" usage of it is in `src_validation.cpp` mempool checks, so should be easy to verify c

@instagibbs: Thanks for the feedback, solid point. I think the easiest way would just be to add a `reason.clear()` before any occurence of `BOOST_CHECK(!IsStandardTx(...));`? I don't see that the reason string is wiped out on entrance of `IsStandardTx`, and I'm hesitating changing policy.cpp for a PR that should merely extend a unit test.
